Name: amidosulfuron production | amidosulfuron | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Amidosulfuron is produced in five steps from methane:;CH4 + SO3 → CH4SO3;CH4SO3 + SOCl2 → CH3ClO2S + SO2 + HCl;CH3ClO2S + CH5N → C2H7NSO2 + HCl;C2H7NSO2 + CClNO3S → C3H6N2S2O5 + HCl;C3H6N2O5S2 + C6H9N3O2 → C9H15N5O7S2;C6H9N3O2 (2-amino-2,4-dimethoxy-pyramidine) is produced in from carbon sulfide and ammonia:;CS2+2NH3 -> NH4SCN+H2S;3NH4SCN -> 2CH5N3+H2S+CS2;CH5N3+C5H8O4 -> C4H5N3O2+2CH4O;C4H5N3O2+POCl3 -> C4H3N3Cl2+H2PO3Cl;C4H3N3Cl2+2CH4O -> C6H9N3O2+2HCl;The formed hydrochloric acid is neutralised with sodium hydroxide and released as emission to water as chloride and sodium.;Reference(s):;Unger T., (1996). Pesticide Synthesis Handbook, Noyes Publication.;Appleby A.P., Muller F., Carpy, S., (2011): Weed Control, in Ullmanns Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.
